nta.declaration: /* Simulation-specific stuff */ urgent broadcast chan bounce; // Forces the "bounce" endge to be taken immediately when available broadcast chan hit; clock time; // I don't recall if this clock is necessary but I use it for the end-condition of learning queries. clock p, v; // Position (m) and velocity (m/s). clock x; // Used to control decision period int resets = 0; // The game resets when the ball "dies" i.e. p=0 and |v|<1. int swings; // Times the player swings at the ball. int hits; // Times those siwings actually affect the state. const double m = 0.5; // Mass of the ball (kg). Roughly matches the weight of a basketball. const double g = 9.81; // Gravity constant (m/s^2).

plot.title: Probability Density Distribution
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.05, bucket width=5, bucket count=22 Runs: 500 in total, 500 (100%) displayed, 0 (0%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [549, 654] Mean estimate of displayed sample: 598.99 ± 1.52848 (95% CI)

query.formula: strategy SwingWell = minE (swings + resets*1000 ) [<=120] {} -> {p, v}: <> time >= 120
